bio.name: Ciro Zhang
bio.description: Data Science and Computer Engineering double major at UC San Diego (GPA: 3.96). I build ML systems that solve real-world problems—from digital pathology pipelines to bioluminescence prediction models. Currently researching at UBC on computer vision for medical diagnostics and at UCSD on ecological time-series forecasting.

focus.title: Computer Vision & Medical AI
focus.description: Building pipelines for digital pathology, document analysis, and object detection. Experience with YOLO, OCR, and fine-tuning vision models for real-world diagnostic applications.

focus.title: ML Systems & NLP
focus.description: Developing end-to-end ML pipelines with PyTorch and TensorFlow. Working with LLMs, embeddings, and transformers for document processing, auto-reply systems, and knowledge extraction.

currentThreads: Building CV/OCR pipelines for pathology textbook analysis at UBC (Dr. Li Xiaoxiao).
Combining EDM time-series models with CNNs for bioluminescence prediction at UCSD (Dr. George Sugihara).
Training YOLO models for cervical cancer cytology detection in digital pathology workflows.

projects.title: Paper Reader: Document AI Pipeline
projects.description: Built a pipeline to convert research PDFs into structured Markdown/JSON datasets. Applied DocLayNet (YOLO) for layout detection and PyMuPDF for text/figure extraction. Reduced noise using regex + BERT-based filtering.

projects.title: Gmail Replier: LLM Auto-Reply Bot
projects.tags: Python • OpenAI API • Gmail API • OAuth
projects.description: Python service that scans Gmail and drafts replies with OpenAI or Ollama, supporting dry-run and safe-prompt modes. Integrated Gmail API with OAuth, custom labels, and robust error-handling with exponential backoff.

projects.title: Fish Game: HTML5 Jumping Game
projects.description: Browser-based jumping game built with vanilla JavaScript and HTML5 Canvas. Features custom physics engine, camera system, and procedurally generated environments. Deployed on GitHub Pages for instant play.

projects.title: HAB Forecasting: Harmful Algal Bloom Prediction
projects.description: Research project predicting harmful algal blooms at Scripps Pier using ensemble ML models (750 models). Multi-timeframe forecasting (1-3 weeks) with configurable thresholds and confidence intervals. Deployed live forecasting tool integrated with SCCOOS monitoring data.

projects.title: Wiki-Graph-Explorer: Wikipedia BFS Game
projects.description: Interactive web app that visualizes paths between Wikipedia articles using BFS graph traversal. Built with Svelte and D3 for dynamic graph visualization. Includes data processing pipeline with Jupyter notebooks for Wikipedia article parsing.

projects.title: DSC10 Practice Platform
projects.description: Practice problem platform for UCSD's DSC 10 course hosting past exams and discussion materials. Built LaTeX-to-Markdown conversion tools and standardized problem formatting system. Supports multiple question types with 53+ contributors and 1,400+ commits.

projects.title: Slice: Android Bill Splitting App
projects.description: Android app for splitting bills among groups. Built with Java using Android Studio with 120+ commits. Features user-friendly interface for tracking expenses and calculating individual shares.

projects.title: OneTouch: Android Shortcut Widget
projects.description: Android widget app providing quick shortcuts and one-tap actions. Built with Java for Android, featuring customizable widgets for improved productivity and quick access to frequently used functions.

research.title: ML for Digital Pathology
research.advisor: Advisor: Dr. Li Xiaoxiao • University of British Columbia
research.description: Building CV/OCR pipeline to extract figure–caption pairs from pathology textbooks for fine-tuning LLMs in diagnostic Q&A. Automated cell-patch cropping in QuPath and trained YOLO models for cervical cancer cytology to detect abnormal cell regions.

research.title: Bioluminescence Prediction with EDM + CNNs
research.advisor: Advisor: Dr. George Sugihara • UC San Diego
research.description: Predicting bioluminescent events on UCSD shores using empirical dynamic modeling (EDM). Co-authoring a manuscript on combining traditional EDM with modern CNNs to boost prediction accuracy. Designed an interactive web tool that visualizes real-time bioluminescence probabilities.

research.title: Charitable Donation Behavior Analysis
research.advisor: Advisor: Dr. Ma Jing Jing • Peking University
research.description: Developed web-scraping tools to extract user data from Tencent charity platforms. Performed statistical analysis to identify keywords and trends that drive higher donation rates.

teaching.description: Lead office hours and discussion sections for 300+ students with Dr. Sanjoy Dasgupta. Developed homework assignments and exams to reinforce understanding of supervised learning, model evaluation, and practical ML workflows in Python.
Provided academic support for introductory data science course with Dr. Janine Tiefenbruck. Held office hours covering Python programming, pandas, data visualization, and statistical analysis.

courses: CSE 190: ML for Music and Audio
